subject: Science
title: Solar Flares and Storms
description: A quick, practical guide to Solar Flares and Storms.

hook.text: In 1859, telegraph operators got electric shocks from their machines for no reason.

buildup.text: Astronomer Richard Carrington had just observed a white flash on the Sun's surface.

discovery.text: The Sun had hurled a billion tons of charged particles straight at Earth.

twist.text: Earth's magnetic field deflected most of it, but auroras lit up near the equator.

climax.text: Today a similar storm could knock out satellites, GPS, and power grids worldwide.

punchline.text: The Sun can shut down civilization with a single sneeze.

quiz.question: What happened during the 1859 Carrington Event?
options: A massive solar storm hit Earth
